subject: created AddReportFutureVersion dbus method
commitMessage:
created AddReportFutureVersion dbus method

New method will support CollectionTimeScope, CollectionDuration

In order to make not breaking interface changes bmcweb will switch to
AddReportFutureVersion, then AddReport will be changed to match
AddReportFutureVersion, then redfish will switch back to use AddReport,
then AddReportFutureVersion will be removed.

Tested:
  - Verified that current version of bmcweb works fine with old API

Signed-off-by: Krzysztof Grobelny <krzysztof.grobelny@intel.com>
Change-Id: I51a9b7fb2f4da5b8d2f688ccd5e93710352b1ac7

Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged by Krzysztof Grobelny
Consider to rename it to report_types.hpp, up to you
Done
Can we also move trigger_types.hpp from interfaces/ to types/ - this would make this refactor more consistent.
Done
Empty 'catch' exception handler, please define catch operation or rethrow if needed.
As far as I understand, this is intended here. This whole try-catch is just to transform metadata in case it is json. But if it's not, then 'old' metadata will already be here.

Maybe it would be good to add a comment with short clarification in the code in here?
Looking at the constructor with empty 'catch' is confusing on first sight.
Done
If notifier is no found in sensors then generic out of range exception is given, maybe customize exception message like 'unknown sensor' would be more informational?
It is something that should never happen.
Ack
Long type definition, maybe type alias by 'using' could give more compact name?
Done

[*] Is there a chance to change magical numbers in std::get<> for something more informational?
I.e. by using enum class?
It was intended, it's simple forwarding. Type doesn't matter, it just matter that we want to forward first argument as first argument.
Ack
Like above in [*], magical numbers make code reading much harder.
Done
Using at_label() would improve readability, and might prevent possible mistake in the future.
Done
Same as in [*], please consider dropping magic numbers in the code.
It was intended, it's simple forwarding. Type doesn't matter, it just matter that we want to forward first argument as first argument.
Ack
If there is only a single reference to utils::tstring namespace then maybe full form of referencing is good enough? I.e.: utils::tstring::OperationType.
It's for consistency, also to make line 158 shorter so clang format can produce better results.
Ack
Is it needed here?
Removed
